ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much about addictions, this was a great class
Good overview of addiction policy in different drug areas.
How to consider complex economic issues behind drug and addiction policies

I developed an understanding of the economics of addiction. We discussed several models for addictive behavior, then tested them empirically. This gave me great experience. Recommend for anyone considering a thesis!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Good material but poorly organised in some cases. Lectures were at times a little hephazard.
The professor was often very disorganized and seemed unprepared to give lectures. It was often hard to follow the lectures
One of my favorites! Jody is a great professor. Very caring and obviously passionate about the material.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Take this if you don't mind a poor structure but interesting material. Sindelar is very smart and caring and kind but sometimes struggles with organization and time management in class which can be frustrating. Final paper is tough if you're a senior and feeling checked out from school. All in all a very chill senior seminar. Don't expect to have your view of the world completely changed, but you will learn some interesting things and the environment will be enjoyable overall!
For sure. It's interesting and Jody is amazing
Yes. But be ready for lectures to be a little disorganised. Workload is definitely manageable. Weekly assignments, a presentation and a final paper

As far as econ senior seminars go, it is a decent option. The subject matter is pretty interesting and the workload is relatively low, but the connection of the addictions material to economics is not always clear. This makes writing the final paper kind of challenging because they expected a pretty high level of economics in the paper. But overall, it is was a fairly enjoyable class.
Yes! Good senior econ seminar that isn't too quant heavy.
Yes -- especially if you're considering going into a related field!
